description: Invites high school students to compete in a comprehensive academic competition covering language, science, and arts, with a focus on the 2023-2024 theme: 'Technology and Humanity.'

name: Hong Kong Mathematics Olympiad
description: 42nd edition for 2024/25; focuses on developing mathematical abilities among high school students, organized by official educational bodies.

name: Massachusetts Academic Decathlon
description: Teams of 9 high school students compete in 10 events, including 7 objective tests and 3 subjective events, promoting academic exploration and culminating in a Super Quiz relay.

name: MathConceptition 2025 - Hong Kong Contest Details
description: Open to 12 grades including 4 secondary levels; individual contest format with questions based on HKEDB Syllabus and Mathematical Olympiad standards.

name: Catskills Regional History Day Contest
description: Engages students in grades 6-12 to research historical topics with creative formats; competition on March 8, 2025, at Milford Central School.

name: International Olympiad in Forensics
description: Open to middle and high school students; features 20+ speech and debate events with $1,500+ cash prize pool at National Championship level.

name: Yau Mathematical Awards Agenda
description: Registration open from February 15 to June 15; national written test on July 14-15; finals on August 13-14 at TSIMF, with an award ceremony on August 14 in Sanya.

name: Social Studies Contest - University Interscholastic League (UIL)
description: 45 objective questions and an essay on 'Modern South Asia' for high school students, emphasizing mastery of primary readings and social studies concepts.

name: AFA CyberPatriot Competition
description: Largest national cyber defense competition for K-12 students, focusing on securing virtual networks and promoting STEM careers.

name: IPhO 2024 - 54th International Physics Olympiad
description: Open to high school students; held July 21-29, 2024, in Isfahan, Iran, organized by the Ministry of Education.

name: National Contest - National History Day
description: In-person competition for 3,000 students at University of Maryland, June 14-18, 2026; categories include Exhibit, Paper, and Website with specific judging times for Junior and Senior Divisions.

name: American Regional Biology Competition
description: Team-based biology competition for high school students; encourages collaboration and problem-solving in life sciences.

name: The Hong Kong Student Science Project Competition 2023
description: 195 secondary school teams competed for science and technology awards; 25th anniversary event with 600 attendees and 20 finalists showcasing innovative projects.

name: Singapore Math Challenge
description: Open to grades 1-10/11; focuses on mathematics education with international benchmarks to improve student performance.

name: International Olympiad on Astronomy and Astrophysics 2025
description: Annual competition for secondary school students in Astronomy and Astrophysics; held in Mumbai from August 11-21, 2025.

name: International Biology Olympiad (IBO)
description: Annual World Championship for high school students; focuses on theoretical and practical biology with topics including Biomedical Sciences and Ecology; 2025 event in Quezon City, Philippines.

name: CyberPatriot National Youth Cyber Defense Competition
description: Engages high school teams in cybersecurity challenges; top performers earn all-expenses-paid trips to national finals and scholarship opportunities.

name: Academic WorldQuest‚Ñ¢ Competition by World Affairs Councils of America
description: Tests knowledge in international politics, geography, and global economics; over 3,000 students compete for a chance to represent their community at the national championship.

name: Global Rounds - The World Scholar's Cup
description: Global Rounds feature events in 2024 across 8 cities, including Kuala Lumpur and Stockholm, leading to the Yale Tournament of Champions; open to students aged 14 and older.

name: U.S. National Chemistry Olympiad
description: Multi-tiered chemistry competition for high school students; eligibility for grades 9-12, with important dates for 2024 including Local and National Exams.

name: NHDI Central Regional Contest
description: Registration opens January 6, 2025; project submissions due by March 5, 2025; competition for high school students (grades 9-12) focused on historical research.

name: Academic Decathlon 101 - OCDE
description: Ten-event competition for high school students covering language, science, and arts; promotes teamwork and academic excellence.

name: National History Day Contest
description: Open to high school students; participants develop historical research projects and compete at regional and national levels, with 3,000 students attending the National Contest each June.

name: International Tournament of Young Mathematicians (ITYM)
description: Online competition from December 11-22, 2024; teams of 4-6 students tackle advanced mathematical problems with no known solutions.

name: NHDI West Regional Contest
description: Open to high school students; registration deadline is February 19, 2024, with project submissions due by February 26, 2024.

name: Breakthrough Junior Challenge
description: Global science video competition for high school students; offers $250,000 scholarship, $50,000 teacher prize, and $100,000 for a science lab.

name: International Economics Olympiad
description: Annual competition for high school students in economics and finance; participation is free and includes multiple-choice and case presentation components.

name: International Logic Olympiad 2024
description: Annual competition for high school students focusing on logical reasoning and problem-solving; final round at Stanford University, with preliminary rounds on March 8, April 19, and April 26, 2025.

name: S.T. Yau High School Science Award (Asia)
description: Open to secondary school students in Hong Kong and Asia; focuses on STEM subjects with scientific oversight and structured assessment.
